abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column examines Brooklyn Nets home loss to Chicago Bulls, praising the visiting team's talent, depth and work ethic; argues that Nets, by contrast, put in a middling performance in a must-win game, and have done little to present themselves as a descent alternative to the moribund New York Knicks.
lead_paragraph: Chicago again displayed its talent, depth and work ethic Monday night in a win over the Nets, who have done little lately to be considered even a viable fan alternative to the Knicks.

headline.main: Bulls Offer Nets a Lesson in Team-Building
headline.print_headline: For Nets, a Lesson in Team-Building

snippet: Chicago again displayed its talent, depth and work ethic Monday night in a win over the Nets, who have done little lately to be considered even a viable fan alternative to the Knicks.
